text: in this video you'll learn how to view
Amazon elastic map reduce metrics in the
Amazon web services Management console
and how to use these reports to track
your job flows progress and performance
to begin log into the Amazon web
services Management console and select
the elastic map ruce tab this shows the
job flows you've launched to view
metrics for a job flow click on it to
bring up the job flow details pane
select the monitoring tab to view
information about that job flow this
loads reports about the progress and
health of the job flow these metrics are
updated every 5 minutes for a close-up
view of a metric click on the graph to
enlarge it you can view how close a job
flow is to finishing by comparing the
map tasks running to the map tasks
remaining and by comparing the reduced
tasks running to the reduced tasks
remaining you can analyze job flow
performance by checking the read and
write statistics to hdfs and Amazon S3
as well as the percentage of hdfs
utilization check the health of a job
Flow by checking for missing blocks this
graph reports the number of blocks which
aren't replicated in htfs these are
often corrupted blocks another indicator
of job flow health is the live data
nodes report which is the percentage of
nodes receiving work from Hadoop nodes
that are not receiving work have likely
been blacklisted for being
non-responsive one of the most important
measures to check is the is idle graph
this is a Boolean graph that is set to
one if no tasks have run and no input
output records have been updated in the
previous 5 minutes you can use this
report to check for blocked or completed
job flows that are still running and
being
build you can also view the Amazon
elastic map reduce metrics from the
cloudwatch tab of the AWS Management
console for more details about the
metrics reported by Amazon elastic map
produce go to the Amazon elastic map
produce developer guide available online
